title: Why don't pros use Hired Gun Lucian?
body: Throughout all of the LCS/Worlds games that I've seen, Lucian (ever since release) has been a very popular pick. However, I have yet to see a **single** pro use the Hired Gun Lucian skin. It's always Classic or Striker Lucian. Why is this??

replies.body:
I use the base skin because I like the sound of pewpewpewpewpewpewpewpewpewpew more than blamblamblamblamblamblamblamblamblamblamblamblam

༼ つ ◕_◕ ༽つ
The bullets from The Culling on the Hired Gun skin appear smaller than the actual hitbox, no real change but when you are a pro gamer visuals mean a lot to you.

Was gonna say I believe it's this. Same reason a lot of pros use Frost Queen Janna (particles feel a bit more readable)

Also sometimes its just preference :p!
I thought there was a list of skins that pro teams couldn't use in tournaments and that's why some skins are never used.
Maybe they just don't like it.

I know some skins are banned from use. iBlitzcrank can't be used because the hitbox on the grab can be difficult to see and dodge sometimes. But I've never heard one about Hired Gun Lucian, maybe because the shots are thinner?

seriously? ?? I typically never have problems dodging blitz but had a really bad game a few days ago against an Iblitz,  I assumed he was just really good but. .. wow. 
Why is the skin not changed... If it's banned in competitive why is it allowed anywhere?  That seems unfair?

Well if they release a skin, they can't just remove it from the servers. Some people don't even know about the visual issues and just like the way the skin looks, and pulling the skin off the live servers would cause a minor uproar, even if they refunded people who bought it. And then, they would have to do the same thing with every other skin that may have questionable visuals, like Hired Gun Lucian, so they could make it fair.
Sorry,  I meant more along the lines of updating the visual to better represent the hitbox.
True. I feel like his autos, q, and r look thinner than classic/striker. I kinda like it. I think hired gun's q is harder to dodge, especially in lane. Maybe that's just me :/

hired gun may also have certain aspects that label things as more revealing or not revealing enough. There are a number of skins that are banned during tournament play because of one of those 2 factors. a great example is arcade hecarim, when he is at 2 stacks multiple areas change color making it obvious he has full stacks on his q buff while his other skins are far more subtle when you reach full stacks. It is small things like this that make a skin unavailable to be used in tournaments.
